verses.text: The hopes of a man void of understanding \add are\add* vain and false: And dreams lift up fools.
Whoso regardeth dreams \add Is\add* like him that catcheth at a shadow, And followeth after the wind.
The vision of dreams \add is\add* the resemblance of one \add thing\add* to another, \add Even as\add* the likeness of a face to a face.
Of an unclean \add thing\add* what can be cleansed? And from \add that thing which is\add* false what truth can come?
Divinations, and soothsayings, and dreams, are vain: And the heart fancieth, as a woman’s \add heart\add* in travail.
If they be not sent from the most High in thy visitation, Set not thy heart upon them.
For dreams have deceived many, And they have failed that put their trust in them.
The law shall be found perfect without lies: And wisdom \add is\add* perfection to a faithful mouth.
A man that hath travelled knoweth many \add things;\add* And he that hath much experience will declare wisdom.
He that hath no experience knoweth little: But he that hath travelled is full of prudence.
When I travelled, I saw many \add things;\add* And I understand more than I can express.
I was ofttimes in danger of death: Yet I was delivered because of these \add things\add*.
The spirit of those that fear the Lord shall live; For their hope \add is\add* in him that saveth them.
Whoso feareth the Lord shall not fear Nor be afraid; for he \add is\add* his hope.
Blessed \add is\add* the soul of him that feareth the Lord: To whom doth he look? And who \add is\add* his strength?

\add For\add* the eyes of the Lord \add are\add* upon them that love him, \add He is their\add* mighty protection and strong stay, A defence from heat, and a cover from the \add sun at\add* noon, A preservation from stumbling, and a help from falling.
He raiseth up the soul, and lighteneth the eyes: He giveth health, life, and blessing.
He that sacrificeth of a \add thing\add* wrongfully gotten, \add his\add* offering \add is\add* ridiculous; And the gifts of unjust \add men are\add* not accepted.
The most High is not pleased with the offerings of the wicked; Neither is he pacified for sin by the multitude of sacrifices.
Whoso bringeth an offering of the goods of the poor \add Doeth as\add* one that killeth the son before his father’s eyes.
The bread of the needy \add is\add* their life: He that defraudeth \add him\add* thereof \add is\add* a man of blood.
He that taketh away \add his\add* neighbour’s living slayeth \add him;\add* And he that defraudeth the labourer of his hire \add is\add* a bloodshedder.
When one buildeth, and another pulleth down, What profit have they \add then\add* but labour?
When one prayeth, and another curseth, Whose voice will the Lord hear?
He that washeth himself after \add the touching of\add* a dead body, if he touch it again, What availeth his washing?
So \add is it with\add* a man that fasteth for his sins, And goeth again, and doeth the same: Who will hear his prayer? Or what doth his humbling profit him?
